commands.name: dev
commands.description: Start the Next.js development server with hot reloading
commands.prompt: Run `pnpm dev` to start the Next.js development server on http://localhost:3000. The server will automatically reload when you make changes to the code.

commands.name: test
commands.description: Run the full Jest test suite
commands.prompt: Run `pnpm test` to execute all unit and integration tests using Jest. For interactive watch mode, use `pnpm test:watch`. To generate a coverage report, use `pnpm test:coverage`.

commands.name: lint
commands.description: Run ESLint to check for code quality and style issues
commands.prompt: Run `pnpm lint` to analyze the codebase for linting errors and potential bugs. This helps maintain code quality and consistency.

commands.name: build
commands.prompt: Run `pnpm build` to create an optimized production build of the Next.js application. This command compiles the code, bundles assets, and prepares the app for deployment.

commands.name: test:e2b
commands.prompt: Run `pnpm test:e2b` to execute the integration tests for the E2B code interpreter and sandbox functionality. These tests ensure that the AI agent can correctly interact with the sandboxed environment.

commands.name: db:up
commands.description: Start the local Supabase database using Docker
commands.prompt: Run `pnpm db:up` to start the local Supabase database in a Docker container. This is required for local development if you are not using a remote database.
